column4: Hey guys, I'm trying to install kpodder - when I type "make" in the untarballed directory I get "command not found" why is that?
Is build essential the command I should use instead of make ?
no, build-essential is a metapackage that has the basic build tools.
you will need more possibly as well... but that should get you started.
you need the -dev of various libs.
What command do I use to download those -dev files?
first you need to know what one.  it is as easy as 'sudo apt-get install blahlib-dev'
when your make fails, go to the TOPMOST error and look there.
it will usually say something like blah header not found.  then you add the lib-dev
you must be in the dir with the makefile.  this means usually starting with ./configure, then make, then make install
nope.  you need your x dev files.
sorry... um... let me quickly look... there are MANY of them.
